metalign.voice

Class Voice

  • java.lang.Object
    • metalign.voice.Voice
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Voice>

    public class Voice
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Voice>
    A SingleNoteVoice is a node in the LinkedList representing a voice. Each node has only a previous pointer and a MidiNote. Only a previous pointer is needed because we allow for Voices to split and clone themselves, keeping the beginning of their note sequences identical. This allows us to have multiple LinkedLists of notes without needing multiple full List objects. Rather, they all point back to their common prefix LinkedLists.
    Author:
    Andrew McLeod - 6 April, 2015

      • pitchScore

        private double pitchScore(double weightedPitch,
                          int pitch,
                          HmmVoiceSplittingModelParameters params)
        Get the pitch closeness of the two given pitches. This value should be higher the closer together the two pitch values are. The first input parameter is a double because it is drawn from getWeightedLastPitch(HmmVoiceSplittingModelParameters).
        Parameters:
        weightedPitch - A weighted pitch, drawn from getWeightedLastPitch(HmmVoiceSplittingModelParameters).
        pitch - An exact pitch.
        Returns:
        The pitch score of the given two pitches, a value between 0 and 1.

      • gapScore

        private double gapScore(long time1,
                        long time2,
                        HmmVoiceSplittingModelParameters params)
        Get the pitch closeness of the two given pitches. This value should be higher the closer together the two pitch values are.
        Parameters:
        time1 - A time.
        time2 - Another time.
        Returns:
        The gap score of the two given time values, a value between 0 and 1.

      • canAddNoteAtTime

        public boolean canAddNoteAtTime(long time,
                                long length,
                                HmmVoiceSplittingModelParameters params)
        Decide if we can add a note with the given length at the given time based on the given parameters.
        Parameters:
        time - The onset time of the note we want to add.
        length - The length of the note we want to add.
        params - The parameters we're using.
        Returns:
        True if we can add a note of the given duration at the given time. False otherwise.

      • getNumNotesCorrect

        public int getNumNotesCorrect()

        Returns:
        The number of notes we've assigned into this voice correctly.

      • getNumLinksCorrect

        public int getNumLinksCorrect(java.util.List<java.util.List<MidiNote>> goldStandard)
        Get the number of links in this Voice which are correct. That is, the number of times that two consecutive notes belong to the same midi channel.
        Parameters:
        goldStandard - The gold standard voices for this song.
        Returns:
        The number of times that two consecutive notes belong to the same midi channel.

      • getGapLengths

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getGapLengths()
        Get the gap lengths for the notes in this Voice. That is, the difference between the first note's offset and the second note's onset for each pair of consecutive notes.
        Returns:
        A List of the gap lengths for each pair of consecutive notes in this Voice.

      • getGapLengthsPositive

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getGapLengthsPositive()
        Get the absolute values of the gap lengths for the notes in this Voice. That is, the absolute value of the difference between the first note's offset and the second note's onset for each pair of consecutive notes.
        Returns:
        A List of the absolute values of the gap lengths for each pair of consecutive notes in this Voice.

      • getGapLengthsPercentage

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Double> getGapLengthsPercentage()
        Get the gap length percentages for the notes in this Voice. That is, the difference between the first note's offset and the second note's onset, divided by the first note's duration, for each pair of consecutive notes.
        Returns:
        A List of the gap length percentages for each pair of consecutive notes in this Voice.

      • getGapLengthsPercentagePositive

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Double> getGapLengthsPercentagePositive()
        Get the absolute values of the gap length percentages for the notes in this Voice. That is, the absolute value of the difference between the first note's offset and the second note's onset, divided by the first note's duration, for each pair of consecutive notes.
        Returns:
        A List of the absolute values of the gap length percentages for each pair of consecutive notes in this Voice.
